column4: I appreciate your desire to help me, but is it not obvious that I have been reading, and still run into issues?
You will notice the * in the output of fdisk is showing its set to an ntfa partition which is wrong

not wrong, just not what you'd expect. Anyhow, it was booting fine until I did some partition manipulation today, and gparted decided it would be a good idea to rename my root partition from /dev/sda6 to /dev/sda5
If you follow the links ubottu gave, you can have it fixed from a live cd in no time
